title: carauction-network has no use for auctioneer
body:
From what I see in the model file + logic.js file, there is no use for the auctioneer. From my understanding, I would think it should be a requirement that only the auctioneer can submit the closeBidding transaction. 

I am working on implementing this pattern for Fabric Node.js SDK, so would be useful for me to know if I should implement the pattern as I have outlined above.

title: Stuck trying to allow manufacturers participants to view their own vehicles
body:
Hi!

I have been learning about the modeling code from the Model Blockchain Business Network, the  Business Logic from the JavaScript file and the ACL rules from the permissions file. Now I want to challenge myself trying to build a query that will allow manufacturers to view their own vehicles.

Having the following Manufacturer Participant ACL:

```
rule ManufacturerCreateVehicles {
    description: "Allow manufacturers to create and view their vehicles"
    participant(m): "org.acme.vehicle_network.Manufacturer"
    operation: CREATE
    resource(v): "org.acme.vehicle_network.Vehicle"
    transaction(tx): "org.acme.vehicle_network.UpdateOrderStatus"
    condition: (v.vehicleDetails.make.getIdentifier() == m.getIdentifier() && tx.orderStatus == "VIN_ASSIGNED")
    action: ALLOW
}

rule ManufacturerReadVehicles {
    description: "Allow manufacturers to create and view their vehicles"
    participant(m): "org.acme.vehicle_network.Manufacturer"
    operation: READ
    resource(v): "org.acme.vehicle_network.Vehicle"
    condition: (v.vehicleDetails.make.getIdentifier() == m.getIdentifier())
    action: ALLOW
}
```

## models/org.vehicle.cto

```
transaction ReadVehicles {
}
```

## lib/script.js

```
/**
 * Allow manufacturers to create and view their vehicles
 * @param {org.acme.vehicle_network.ReadVehicles} readVehicles - the ReadVehicles transaction
 * @transaction
 */
function readVehicles() {
	console.log('readVehicles');

  	var factory = getFactory();
  	var namespace = 'org.acme.vehicle_network';
}
```

...buuut I am stuck trying to submit the ReadVehicles transaction as the Arium Manufacturer participant using the local composer playground:

```
{
  "$class": "org.acme.vehicle_network.ReadVehicles"
}
```

## Error

```
Error trying invoke business network. 

Error: No valid responses from any peers. 

Response from attempted peer comms was an error: Error: chaincode error (status: 500, message: Error: Participant 'org.acme.vehicle_network.Manufacturer#Arium' 

does not have 'CREATE' access to resource 

'org.acme.vehicle_network.ReadVehicles#03755655c696a8bede23812db277ad96c2fe2ed9b9155b741857f5c4d163631c')
```

Thanks hackers!

title: Clearing House Sample Network
body:
## Overview

A new sample network is proposed: a clearing house. Clearing houses represent a scenario that may be elegantly solved by the abstractions provided by Composer.

A Clearing house is a financial institution formed to facilitate the exchange (i.e., clearance) of payments, securities, or derivatives transactions. After legally-binding agreement of a trade between a buyer and a seller, the role of the clearing house is to centralize and standardize all of the steps leading up to the payment of the transaction. The purpose is to reduce the cost, settlement risk and operational risk of clearing and settling multiple transactions among multiple parties.

It is feasible to remove the central clearing house and replace the operation through a series of smart contracts, with all banking parties acting to progress the clearing of funds through interactions with a shared ledger.

## Outline

We will consider the batch clearing of inter-bank payments, with netting. The netting aspect acts to consolidate payments into fewer transfers, for instance if A owes B $1000 and B owes A $100, then A will be required to transfer $900 to B during clearing.

### Participants

BankingParticipant - a participant involved with fund transfers to/from another BankingParticipant


### Assets
TransferRequest - a request to transfer funds from one BankingParticipant to another

BatchTransferRequest - a Batch of TransferRequest assets

### Transactions
A series of Transactions will be required from all participants to move the Assets from an initial state to a complete (clearing complete/settled) state:

  - CreateBatchTransaction
  - MarkPreProcessTransferComplete
  - CompleteSettlement
  - MarkPostProcessTransferComplete

### Access Control

BankingParticipants
- Only able to view Assets (Trades) within which they are participating
- Only be able to update Asset fields that relate to them

title: Non-admin identities in unit tests
body:
How to get unit tests with non-admin identities work with composer 0.15 (also see the same issue with 0.16)?
In the updated sample of a unit test for a business network  the identity used to connect with is a network admin user 'admin'. 
In my unit test I try to create a new identity for my test user, then construct and import its card, and then connect to the business network with this card. As follows:
```businessNetworkConnection.issueIdentity(NS + '#' + userData.id, userData.user);
....      
var userCard = new IdCard({...});
userCard.setCredentials(credentials);
...
adminConnection.importCard(userCardName, userCard);
....
businessNetworkConnection.connect(userCardName))
...
```
However, importCard() throws an error that the identity already exists. Seems like embeddedConnectionProfile attempts to add the identity to the identities registry as part of importCard call, but it's already been added there by issueIdentity?
What am I doing wrong here? 
Would be nice to have the unit test sample updated to include this scenario.

title: Add additional permissions to composer samples
body:
Hi regarding [the marbles](https://github.com/hyperledger/composer-sample-networks/tree/master/packages/marbles-network) example, I would like to see some additional participant specific permissions.
This would prevent any malicious `Person` from modifying someone else `marbles`. I would like to open a PR and make such changes if allowed, however when I do this locally, the `TradeMarble` transaction throws an error.

I am keen on contributing to this repo and add such ACL features, as I could not find examples of the same anywhere, nor on stackoverflow. I think this will be an important feature that should be demonstrated and would like to take it on with some assistance
```
rule SampleConditionalRuleWithTransaction {
    description: "Ensure changes to Marble can only be done via a transaction"
    participant(m): "org.hyperledger_composer.marbles.Player"
    operation: UPDATE
    resource(v): "org.hyperledger_composer.marbles.Marble"
    transaction(tx): "org.hyperledger_composer.marbles.TradeMarble"
    condition: (true)
    action: ALLOW
}

```

Please let me know if this is acceptable and whether I can open a PR for the same. The [docs](https://hyperledger.github.io/composer/reference/acl_language.html) mention a `Transactions` feature but have no demonstrable examples.

title: add fake timers to enable timestamp advancing
body:
Perishable network was failing tests because it was no longer possible to change the time of a transaction timestamp.

We can (should) use sinon.fakeTimers for that purpose

This PR adds sinon to devDeps, and uses a fake timer to artificially advance the timestamp of a transaction so we can test the contract violation correctly.

Signed-off-by: Nick Lincoln <nkl199@yahoo.co.uk>

title: solution for issue 1500
body:
Signed-off-by: shacshar <shacshar@in.ibm.com>

Problem
The issue #1500 deals with the fact that a query in vehicle lifecycle network is not running.

Solution
The query Native is not supported now. The feature of Named Query has been implemented instead. The same is added here in.

https://github.com/hyperledger/composer-sample-networks/pull/95

TestCase
A new testcase has been added to check the functionality of queryNative. The test case select all vehicles by colour (in the test case colour = "Beige") and selected vehicle status is marked "scrapped"

```
my-network npm install hashtable
npm WARN deprecated node-uuid@1.4.8: Use uuid module instead

> hashtable@2.0.2 install /Users/michaelcai/Desktop/GiveBack/my-network/node_modules/hashtable
> node-gyp configure build

  CXX(target) Release/obj.target/native/src/hashtable.o
In file included from ../src/hashtable.cpp:1:
../src/hashtable.h:7:10: fatal error: 'tr1/unordered_map' file not found

         ^
1 error generated.
make: *** [Release/obj.target/native/src/hashtable.o] Error 1
gyp ERR! build error 
gyp ERR! stack Error: `make` failed with exit code: 2
gyp ERR! stack     at ChildProcess.onExit (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/npm/node_modules/node-gyp/lib/build.js:258:23)
gyp ERR! stack     at emitTwo (events.js:125:13)
gyp ERR! stack     at ChildProcess.emit (events.js:213:7)

gyp ERR! System Darwin 16.7.0
gyp ERR! command "/usr/local/Cellar/node/8.4.0/bin/node" "/usr/local/lib/node_modules/npm/node_modules/node-gyp/bin/node-gyp.js" "configure" "build"
gyp ERR! cwd /Users/michaelcai/Desktop/GiveBack/my-network/node_modules/hashtable

gyp ERR! node-gyp -v v3.6.2
gyp ERR! not ok 
npm ERR! code ELIFECYCLE

npm ERR! This is probably not a problem with npm. There is likely additional logging output above.

npm ERR! A complete log of this run can be found in:
npm ERR!     /Users/michaelcai/.npm/_logs/2017-09-13T19_18_13_771Z-debug.log 
```

If anyone has seen this error just run

```npm install```  on the directory

title: Unable to deploy to V0.6
body:
Using this repo and the tutorial located here: https://hyperledger.github.io/composer/tutorials/developer-guide.html , I am unable to successfully deploy. 
```
composer network deploy --loglevel INFO -a ./dist/bd-test-network.bna -p hlfv0.6 -i PeerAdmin -s randomString
```
returns the following error every time: 
```
Deploying business network from archive: ./dist/bd-test-network.bna
Business network definition:
	Identifier: bd-test-network@0.1.5
	Description: The Hello World of Hyperledger Composer samples


Error: Identity lookup error: sql: no rows in result set
Command failed
```

I am working with V0.6 to build a tutorial for Bluemix. Currently the only available free version to developers is V0.6, so the current version of the tutorial is based on that release.  Have already reviewed [this stackoverflow question]([https://stackoverflow.com/questions/43408412/no-rows-in-result-set-when-trying-to-deploy-a-business-network](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/43408412/no-rows-in-result-set-when-trying-to-deploy-a-business-network)) 
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/43408412/no-rows-in-result-set-when-trying-to-deploy-a-business-network
but the provided guidance is based on V1 and the presence of a connection profile, neither of which are referenced in this repo or associated tutorial

title: Conflicting Composer Versions
body:
I've noticed that many of the package.json documents have conflicting composer versions. For example, in basic-sample-network the package.json file looks like this:


```
  "engines": {
    "composer": "^0.10.0"
  }

  "devDependencies": {
...
    "composer-admin": "^0.9.0",
    "composer-cli": "^0.9.0",
    "composer-client": "^0.9.0",
    "composer-connector-embedded": "^0.9.0",
    "composer-cucumber-steps": "^0.9.0",
...
  }
```

As a result, my composer engine is version 10.0, but my chaincode is version 0.9.2, which is causing a lot of issues.

How does composer archive map the correct network
body:
In the digitalproperty example:

When creating a archive:
`composer archive create --sourceType dir --sourceName . -a ./dist/digitalproperty-network.bna`

To me this looks like it would pick up `index.js` (due to `--sourceName .`), but `index.js` is empty... how does it pick up `lib/DigitalLandTitle.js`? How does this work?

title: update to make scripts aware of 0.4.5 CLI
body:
The create archive command is now

```
composer archive create --archiveFile digitialPropertyNetwork.zip --sourceType module --sourceName digitalproperty-network

Options:
  --help             Show help  [boolean]
  -v, --version      Show version number  [boolean]
  --archiveFile, -a  Business network archive file name. Default is based on the Identifier of the BusinessNetwork  [string]
  --sourceType, -t   The type of the input containg the files used to create the archive [ module | dir ]  [required]
  --sourceName, -n   The Location to create the archive from e.g. NPM module directory or Name of the npm module to use  [required]

```
